description: This file declares the interface for a string buffer utility in C, including functions for creating, destroying, appending strings, and retrieving the buffer contents.

methods.name: stringBufferCreate
methods.description: Creates a new StringBuffer instance with a specified initial size, or default if non-positive.

methods.name: stringBufferDestroy
methods.description: Destroys a StringBuffer instance and frees associated memory.

methods.name: void stringBufferDestroy__auto(icStringBuffer ** stringBuffer)
methods.description: Inline helper for cleanup of StringBuffer using auto-clean mechanism.

methods.name: stringBufferAppend
methods.description: Appends a null-terminated string to the buffer, copying its contents.

methods.name: stringBufferAppendLength
methods.description: Appends a specified number of characters from a source string to the buffer.

methods.name: stringBufferAppendWithComma
methods.description: Appends a string to the buffer with optional comma placement.

methods.name: stringBufferLength
methods.description: Returns the current length of the buffer's contents.

methods.name: stringBufferToString
methods.description: Returns the buffer contents as a string, caller must free the result.
